t: Psalm 102
A prayer of an afflicted person who has grown weak and pours out a lament before the Lord.
Hear*pn my prayer, Lord;*s let*ld my cry for help come to you.
Do*ln not hide your face from me when*ld I am in distress. Turn*ln your ear to me; when*ld I call, answer me quickly.
For*pn my days vanish like smoke; my*ld bones burn like glowing embers.
My*ln heart is blighted and withered like grass; I*ld forget to eat my food.
In*ln my distress I groan aloud and*ld am reduced to skin and bones.
I*ln am like a desert owl, like*ld an owl among the ruins.
I*ln lie awake; I have become like*ld a bird alone on a roof.
All*ln day long my enemies taunt me; those*ld who rail against me use my name as a curse.
For*ln I eat ashes as my food and*ld mingle my drink with tears
because*ln of your great wrath, for*ld you have taken me up and thrown me aside.
My*ln days are like the evening shadow; I*ld wither away like grass.
But*pn you, Lord,*s sit enthroned forever; your*ld renown endures through all generations.
You*ln will arise and have compassion on Zion, for*ld it is time to show favor to her; the*ld appointed time has come.
For*ln her stones are dear to your servants; her*ld very dust moves them to pity.
The*ln nations will fear the name of the Lord,*s all*ld the kings of the earth will revere your glory.
For*ln the Lord*s will rebuild Zion and*ld appear in his glory.
He*ln will respond to the prayer of the destitute; he*ld will not despise their plea.
Let*pn this be written for a future generation, that*ld a people not yet created may praise the Lord:*s
“The*ln Lord*s looked down from his sanctuary on high, from*ld heaven he viewed the earth,
to*ln hear the groans of the prisoners and*ld release those condemned to death.”
So*ln the name of the Lord*s will be declared in Zion and*ld his praise in Jerusalem
when*ln the peoples and the kingdoms assemble*ld to worship the Lord.*s
In*pn the course of my life he broke my strength; he*ld cut short my days.
So*ln I said: “Do*ln not take me away, my God, in the midst of my days; your*ld years go on through all generations.
In*ln the beginning you laid the foundations of the earth, and*ld the heavens are the work of your hands.
They*ln will perish, but you remain; they*ld will all wear out like a garment. Like*ln clothing you will change them and*ld they will be discarded.
But*ln you remain the same, and*ld your years will never end.
The*ln children of your servants will live in your presence; their*ld descendants will be established before you.”
